body:
Alright, it seems like there is a lot of rant about how the "Spanky spade" is too expensive. Personally, I love how it's 30 points to buy one, instead of 7 quick kills. 
My points on why I agree with the change:

◇ It completely ruined the gameplay. One person could annihilate the the opposing team! It now makes the match even...
◇ Everyone seemed to be too reliant on it too.
◇ It now encourages other items to be used.

Now it's your turn;
Discuss why you agree or disagree with this change.

Reminder: Keep things mature, and please refrain from starting a flame war!
body_tagged:

replies.body:
Make it 15 points and kb 2

Honestly, it's OP and UP at the same time. Now before you go hitting players with it, know it's wood sword damage. If you are on a non-void map or a map with walls or barriers so you can't get knocked out of the world, you don't do a whole lot of damage. But it's still very useful. If you see a player who has better armor than you, whip out your spade. If it is a void map, they will see it and consider you now a dangerous player to approach. Also, you can use it to push players back, allowing you to clear out the are I from of you spawn. And yeah, you can hit full diamond guys off the edge. HOWEVER, the spanky spade is best used in conjunction with armor, since your hits will do less. And it's important you keep it hidden sometimes because when I see a guy with a spade I immediately shoot as many arrows as I can at him.

  So is it OP? In the right hands, hell yeah

replies.body:
Honestly, spanky spades didn't seem to work with me for some
reason, I hit a player several times and get killed in attempt to knock it off, if I'm going to
knock someone out of the map I'll snipe them or spam them with my regular sword, much more effective (in my case) now that they've nerfed it so much and made it so expensive I doubt I'll ever use it again, I don't like how your hunger bar goes down so fast now either, the only thing I use the nebula shop for now is buying food or apples, such a shame, it has become too overpriced as well, imo, I don't completely   agree with the new prices or nerfed items

Why not change it 21 points-- I feel like that's a good price :3

replies.body:
Back in the olden days when golden apples ACTUALLY dropped it was pretty easy to get 7 points pretty fast. Nowadays even when you save up 30 points to buy the damn thing you barley get to use it due to the fact that golden apples don't drop so you can't get health back as quick.

I would be fine with it being 20-30 points IF golden apples dropped.
But as of now without golden apple drops, 10-20 points would be more suitable.

EDIT: I have not been on in a little bit so they may have fixed that glitch :P

Yah I would be fine with it being 30 points for
if getting a monument was 10 points again. Getting a monument should be the hardest thing in the game because it is the point of the game.

replies.body:
Woahhh. Ok, lots of new info streaming into my mind right now. 
Based upon the info from this post, I do also agree that the Spanky Spade seriously needs to be nerfed. 

Knockback I, 30 points and level 30??? 

I'm pretty sure the points do reset... so getting a 30 kill streak is pretty dang hard. And then the monument grabbing isn't important because you usually die after getting a couple/few monuments or the game is over and then the points transfer... 
But back to the point, a 30 kill streak is pretty dang hard, unless you're in Zalidor or Quintus crushing the foes, which you don't really need a spanky spade for. 
Seriously, I think the points should be lowered to 21 to keep the "Multiple of 7" thing going, make it knockback II and just get rid of the level requirement. I seriously do believe that the level requirement should be rid of because we want new players to experience a cool trademark of Nebula, the spanky spade.
replies.body_tagged:
Woahhh. Ok, lots of new info streaming into my mind right now. 
Based upon the info from this post, I do also agree that the Spanky Spade seriously needs to be nerfed. 

Knockback I, 30 points and level 30??? 

I'm pretty sure the points do reset... so getting a 30 kill streak is pretty dang hard. And then the monument grabbing isn't important because you usually die after getting a couple/few monuments or the game is over and then the points transfer... 
But back to the point, a 30 kill streak is pretty dang hard, unless you're in Zalidor or Quintus crushing the foes, which you don't really need a spanky spade for. 
Seriously, I think the points should be lowered to 21 to keep the "Multiple of 7" thing going, make it knockback II and just get rid of the level requirement. I seriously do believe that the level requirement should be rid of because we want new players to experience a cool trademark of Nebula, the spanky spade.

replies.body:
imo I think the Spanky Spade is expensive. Yes, the knockback is ridiculously powerful (especially for low ping players like me) but honestly the price is so high that it's practically non-existent in play now. 7 points was a bit too easy to get, but 30 is just extremely high (especially when the price for gapples/other items have increased as well.) As many people suggested a price of 15 points would be more reasonable; a happy medium between 7 and 30.

Also, did you guys nerf the Spanky Spade as well? I'm pretty sure that it was Knockback II before, and last time I checked it was Knockback I. Correct me if I'm wrong...
